isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 7 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER PS110-7, PS145-7 - REASSEMBLE - CASE AND GEARS

step1.para: Reassembly of the unit begins by placing the lower reverse idler gear into the case. Then install the left side countershaft and the right side countershaft ( Figure 70).

figure.caption: Figure 70. Install Left and Right Side Countershafts
Figure 71. Blocks For Timing Gears

step1.para: Align the countershaft timing marks toward the center of the case ( Figure 72).

figure.caption: Figure 72. Align Countershaft Timing Marks

step1.para: Insert the lower idler shaft with lockball ( Figure 73).

figure.caption: Figure 73. Insert Lower Idler Shaft With Lockball

step1.para: Set the upper reverse idler gear into the case; do not install the idler shaft at this time ( Figure 74).

figure.caption: Figure 74. Set Upper Reverse Idler Gear Into Case

step1.para: Lower the mainshaft assembly into the case ( Figure 75).

figure.caption: Figure 75. Lower Mainshaft Assembly Into Case

step1.para: Cut the lockwire and slide the reverse gear rearward. Install the 1st gear bore snap ring ( Figure 76).

figure.caption: Figure 76. Install 1st Gear Bore Snap Ring

step1.para: Install the internally and externally splined thrust washers. Secure them with the gear bore snap ring ( Figure 77).

figure.caption: Figure 77. Install Thrust Washers

step1.para: Install the internally splined thrust washer and secure it with the mainshaft snap ring ( Figure 78).

figure.caption: Figure 78. Install Thrust Washer and Secure With Mainshaft Snap Ring

step1.para: Install the output bearing onto the shaft with a suitable driver. It is properly seated when the snap ring sets against the case ( Figure 79).

figure.caption: Figure 79. Install Output Bearing onto Shaft

step1.para: With the help of a lift hook, set the countershafts in time by matching the alignment marks ( Figure 80).

figure.caption: Figure 80. Set Countershafts in Time

step1.para: Install both the front and rear bearings on one of the countershafts ( Figure 81).

figure.caption: Figure 81. Install Front and Rear Bearings on Countershaft

step1.para: Repeat the procedure for the remaining countershaft ( Figure 82).

figure.caption: Figure 82. Repeat Procedure For Remaining Countershaft

step1.para: Install the countershaft drive gear keys ( Figure 83).

figure.caption: Figure 83. Install Countershaft Drive Gear Keys

step1.para: Slide the drive gear onto the shaft. Use two of the .375-16 x 3.00 grade eight bolts used for securing the clutch housing to the case. Place these in the two bolt holes in the gear, and thread them into the tapped installation holes provided in the case ( Figure 84).

figure.caption: Figure 84. Slide Drive Gear onto Shaft

step1.para: Using the alternating method, draw the gear onto the shaft until it is seated behind the snap ring groove. Repeat this method for the other gear ( Figure 85).

figure.caption: Figure 85. Draw Gear onto Shaft

step1.para: Once the gears are seated, install the snap rings and the 6th-7th clutch gear ( Figure 86).

figure.caption: Figure 86. Install Snap Rings and 6th-7th Clutch Gear

step1.para: Apply a light coat of purple Loctite 515 or the equivalent to the clutch housing. Attach the housing to the case and secure it with bolts. Tighten them to 150 to 180 ft-lbs. (203 to 244 N•m) ( Figure 87).

figure.caption: Figure 87. Attach Housing to Case

step1.para: Lubricate the pocket bearing with Moly#2 before installing the input shaft ( Figure 88).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Lubricate Pocket Bearing

step1.para: Place the input bearing cap and gasket over the input shaft ( Figure 89). Be careful to align it with the clutch housing oil hole. Tighten the bolts to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 89. Place Input Bearing Cap and Gasket Over Input Shaft

step1.para: Install the upper reverse idler shaft ( Figure 90).

figure.caption: Figure 90. Install Upper Reverse Idler Shaft

note.para: It is difficult to align the gear with the case hole unless the input shaft is in the unit. It is also necessary to lift up on the mainshaft reverse gear to obtain proper alignment.

step1.para: The output bearing cap and gasket may be assembled to the case ( Figure 91). Tighten the bolts to 78 to 98 ft-lbs. (106 to 133 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 91. Assemble Output Bearing Cap and Gasket to Case

step1.para: Place the countershaft bearing caps on the case and secure them with bolts ( Figure 92). Tighten to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 92. Place Countershaft Bearing Caps on Case

step1.para: Install the shifter housing and secure it with bolts ( Figure 93). Tighten to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 93. Install Shifter Housing
